author: Demip96
title: My daughter's operation
body:
Our daughter was 1 year 2 months old when she came along to the team at Glasgow for her craniofacial operation.  
Our daughter had a unsymmetrical head and face shape, we had consultation appointments before the operation happened with the team in Edinburgh and then Glasgow, we were so scared for her operation although she would never know it. Remember this it was a stressful time for us as her parents as we expected the worst.  
From the minute we started speaking to Lauren to get this operation booked in to arriving, every single staff member was amazing with us from start to finish!  
The morning of her operation was the scariest day of our lives but again the team at Glasgow children’s ward got us through with their fantastic support.  
After our daughter came back round and we got to see her it was a massive relief as what we expected wasn’t there. The next few days were tough seeing her wee face swollen but again was nowhere near what we expected and she recovered amazing within the week.  
On behalf of myself my partner and my daughter we can’t thank enough the children's ward, the surgeons and everyone else who played a massive role in her time at the hospital.  
The outcome of this operation is amazing and the staff are absolutely fantastic I have never been to a hospital and felt so welcomed and had that much support from all involved!  
Again we can’t thank yous enough.  
Lots of love.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: Tomo68
title: Steroid injection from exemplary staff
body:
I went in to Cannock Hospital for steroid injections. I was greeted on the ward by Carolyn who was friendly and efficient. She directed me to my room on the ward where a lovely lady (I think her name was Jayne) explained what would happen and took my obs.  
I was taken down to theatre at my appointment time by a lovely gent (sorry didn’t catch his name) He checked my understanding of the procedure and put me at ease.  
Once in theatre, I was met by professional and friendly staff who confirmed I was comfortable and at ease. Simon, one of the technicians, chatted to me throughout the short procedure and kept me engaged to the point that the doctor was applying the dressing before I realised it was done.  
I can’t praise the staff in theatre enough, they do a high pressured job, often under stressful conditions and yet still manage to smile and put patients at ease. I wish I could name them all as they deserve recognition, but I only noted the name of Simon and Patrick who was another that kept my mind off the procedure.  
On leaving theatre I was handed over to Fay for more obs and finally on to Laura, both of whom were reassuring and informative. Laura provided me with coffee and biscuits. I was left for approximately 30 mins to rest and then Laura came in to check I could stand and walk before discharging me.  
I have had a few hospital procedures over recent years, but I must say that Cannock Hospital and it’s staff are exemplary.

author: J0@nne
title: Cancelled operation after admission to Day of Surgery Unit
body:
After my Day Procedure was cancelled because the anaesthetist wanted me admitted to the Day of Surgery, within the main hospital, I was rescheduled for another Covid Screening Test and then I was admitted to the day of surgery.  
Numerous paperwork, tests and checks were completed and I was transferred into bed which took the effort and time of three nurses and a hoist (in a ward that was understaffed). I was gowned up, surgical stockings on, pre op meds administered and ready for theatre, only to told that my surgery was cancelled and the consultant would be round to reschedule.  
I was told this was because theatre time ran out for the list. I was 3rd on due to delays in theatres, as a result of theatre also being short-staffed and other unforeseen complications which I fully appreciate, understand and respect.  
I am writing this to highlight a growing issue of concern for the future of the NHS… not to point fault or blame as the care and attention to every detail was of a high standard.  
If anything yes, I naturally felt disappointed and couldn’t wait to go home… but mostly because of the effort it had taken from my domiciliary care, my dad and the NHS staff to get me there and ready for surgery.  
Systems, paperwork and much more needs to be addressed going forward if we truly are going to ‘build back better’ and address the wastage in time and resources.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: PeterAS
title: I had a test checking my urine sample and blood
body: I feel the place overall is well organised apart of waiting time when I was have about 50 minutes delay with my appointment. However the practitioner was well prepared offered me vaccination against something B but I decided to not take it. As I want to resign from having risky sexual encounters. I am waiting for my results from screening. Hopefully I am any of those sexual diseases free. I feel secure and comfortable at this visit. I would strongly recommend to anyone who had sexual contact with strangers to check for health conditions and any diseases.

author: AT51
title: Day patient experience
body: I attended Wishaw General, North Lanarkshire, Scotland as a day patient for a surgical biopsy. From start to finish I would like to commend all staff for their care. They were outstanding and made me feel at ease throughout. Their dedication, professionalism, teamwork and overall care could not be faulted. I observed the ward team especially from late morning through to early evening and their continued hard work and attention to detail could not be missed. They are a well oiled machine and their experience, camaraderie and overall communication and teamwork was on display throughout. You should be proud that they represent your hospital. 5 stars out of 5 for all concerned. Thank You !

author: Rory McGuffin
title: Virtual visiting from the Isle of Wight
body:
I am on the Isle of Wight and was able to contact my aunt through virtual visiting.  
Fantastic to see her as she is 92. I don’t think she thought it was real.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Overall I am very happy
body:
Walked into Accident and Emergency and was told we had to call the number and make an appointment. Had to wait half an hour for them to call and then get an appointment. When we were in A&E we waited 7 hours to be seen by multiple doctors and taken up to the Daisy Ward. Everything is lovely and the staff so friendly. The nurse in A&E was so good to us but I cannot think of her name. Overall I am very happy.  
There was a few times I needed help with my daughter and there was no one about I had to go looking for them. The toilets were in a bad state, I had to ask for it to be cleaned as my daughter had diarrhea, and was weak so was struggling going round to the other toilet in the hospital. Also, the phone number and appointment service needs to be more well-known as it wasted a lot of time for my daughter to get checked out by a doctor.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: leatherph57
title: Treated well at my appointment at radiology department
body:
Had an appointment to attend for CT heart scan.  
I was met by Nurse Michelle who was so so pleasant and explained the procedure to me. I was treated very respectfully by both the radiologists and Nurse Michelle.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jak45!
title: My experiences during recent day surgery at University Hospital Wishaw
body: I attended University Hospital Wishaw on, for day surgery. On arrival I was greeted by Nurse Lorraine, whose welcoming friendly manner put me at ease instantly. Furthermore she also began my preparation for my surgery, explaining what would happen in a friendly manner and gave me every opportunity to ask questions. After being settled into the ward, prior to surgery my observations were well monitored. The professionalism of the nurses I interacted with helped take away any nerves I may have had regarding my surgery, I felt relaxed and calm. The nursing staff in particular Lorraine, Cheryl and Elsbeth contributed to a very positive experience, due to the high standard of care and attention to my needs. I also would also like to thank my surgeon Dr Kumar who both before and after surgery, spent time with me, attending to my welfare and answering any questions that I had. Overall the extremely professional, intuitive and compassionate medical staff exceeded any expectations that I had surrounding this procedure, and I would like to extend my heart felt thanks and gratitude to all involved in the above.

title: Wonderful Caring staff
body: My Mum had been in and out of Kings Mill since Christmas day and each time we experienced nothing but kindness and caring from every member of staff we encountered starting with the ambulance service,  A &E staff,  porters,  careworkers,  nurses and doctors,  she couldn't have had better treatment,  sadly she passed away but even down to that they made sure I was looked after whilst I  sat with my Mum...thank you Kings Mill you're all doing a fantastic job

author: Newbreeze
title: Day surgery
body:
I would like to thank all the staff in the day surgery unit for their wonderful care, attention and for making my appointment go smoothly.  
Great staff, great facility and we are so lucky to have such a local asset.  
Thank you.

title: Always helpful
body: I have never had an issue with this gp, I have been registered with them since I moved to the area from London and was also pregnant. For both myself and my newborn I have always been seen quickly, e-consults responded to rapidly, concerns always addressed and staff are always friendly. I cannot fault them and they are by far better than my previous gp in London

title: Excellent medical practice
body: The medical advice and service provided was excellent and professional as well as cordial. The telephone system advising the position of the caller is very helpful.

title: Caring practice
body:
Saw doctor face to face!!
Very pleasant and very satisfied with consultation. First time of seeing this Doctor and was very impressed with his pleasant attitude.

title: Got to see me quick
body: Really nice doctor talked to me and listened talking about my diabetes my new bloods show I’ve done really well

author: Hearme
title: Excellent service from this department
body: Phoned after many months of hearing aids not working though not a problem as was shielding at home. Extremely helpful lady led me basic check and sent out new tubes . Unfortunately I had discarded a vital part to attach tubes! Contacted department again and Danielle  kindly  immediately offered to send missing part. Excellent service from this department.

author: ADEMed
title: Compassion and professionalism from my nurse
body:
My nurse on ward 61 GRI has been exceptionally helpful in a situation of serious lack of communication by others which was not her fault at all.  
Despite the upset and physical discomfort caused, her care has been exemplary in respect of her compassion and professionalism which I have found to be very reassuring and has made me actually feel that I’m in a much better place to make a good recovery than I was at some stages previously. Please make sure this positive and quite inspirational care is recorded and brought to attention.

title: Very helpful staff greatly appreciated
body: I was very late to my appointment but they fitted myself in! Would definitely recommend to everyone as the nurse calmed me down and done my blood test without me feeling a thing!

title: Excellent Surgery
body: Both Doctors have looked after myself and my family for many years  and we have received excellent care from them.They are professional,thorough,and go above and beyond to help.

author: attendantny39
title: Staff have been brilliant
body: Had a very enjoyable experience the service I have received has been fantastic and the staff have been brilliant and very helpful to my recovery.

author: lepusrr78
title: My experience during endoscopy
body:
I had my endoscopy (OGD) under sedation at Nddh today, I was quite relaxed as everyone was quite friendly and this made me feel comfortable. My procedure was done by Mr Arain and team (Matthias & Jackie) and everyone one was very professional and kind.
The procedure went smoothly and all I can say is a big thank to everyone.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Linjt76
title: Contact tracing call
body: We were quite shocked when the whole family were positive for COVID - my daughter had been very tired and everyone was "under the weather" but in all honesty we took the test thinking "I'll rule this out"; As a nurse I had a fair idea of what was required but we did keep an eye on our phones for the contact tracing service. They did call us about 24hours later which was fair enough. The call was quite quick and not necessarily informative. The call handler talked a lot about his experience of COVID as a healthcare professional and when he heard I was a nurse he said "you probably know all this". He was perfectly lovely and we had a good chat but I don't think the information given met my expectations. It felt quite rushed. Also I thought it was very strange that after this call, some time later someone else rang my husband to say exactly the same things.

title: Excellent Service
body: My visit to my Gynae follow up appointment was excellent from start to finish. I was given a choice of clinics to visit and chose one local to myself. I was seen on my appointment time and met by a very pleasant nurse. I was introduced to the consultant who put me at ease.  He chatted with me during the procedure and made sure I was comfortable throughout. All in all it was a very pleasant experience. I would definitely recommend this service to family & friends.

title: Fantastic care
body: Everyone involved in my procedure from arrival to the department at 7am, until leaving at 6pm were amazing. Incredibly professional, respectful, friendly and genuinely caring. I was anxious going in due to previous health experiences but the staff were really reassuring. It’s unbelievable how hard they work and how many hours they are on their feet, yet they still find the energy to really care. Such a positive experience.

author: airsr75
title: Dermatology
body: Minor op to remove skin cancer.The service by Dr Erdel,Clarinda and Dan was exceptional,so informative,caring and friendly,made me feel very much at ease.

title: They do there best and try to help
body:
Looked after Myself and husband when we were going through a difficult time. 
The mental nurse practitioner was excellent, and helped us so much.

title: Couldn’t ask for more from a practice
body: Can’t speak highly enough of every member of the team at Park View. A phenomenal number of patients are seen by this practice yet every interaction seems personal.

author: jonoaten
title: Hilton Ward
body: Had quite a major knee op at Cannock and spent the night and a lot of the next day in the Hilton Ward. Could not speak more highly of all of the staff that took care of me during my stay.  Attentive and non judgemental the whole time I was there and kept all of us on the ward in as good spirits as we could be day and night. Thank you all so much for making my visit as comfortable as it could be, you are all a credit to your vocation

title: Great IUD fitting. contraceptive
body:
My name is Olla and i got my IUD fitting by Doctor Naomi Goodhand with nurse Rachel assisting. The process was not painful at all, just a slight discomfort. I was so scared getting my IUD fitted but the service was excellent, the doctor took time to answer all my questions and was very gentle and professional. Nurse was also very helpful and caring. I made a decision to keep going to the same hospital just because of them. 
Fitting the IUD wasnt painful, having abit of cramps a day after which is expected and am using painkillers. 
I hope this review is helpful to someone out there. All the best of luck.

title: Grateful thanks
body:
After experiencing what I thought was indigestion, I phoned 111 who sent an ambulance. Very short wait before admitted to A&E, then Bolton ward.
Various test done, I had a heart attack. Transferred to Yorkshire Heart Centre for angioplasty.
Thanks to all the staff who looked after me, I am glad to be alive!

title: Chest X Ray Department
body: First class friendly service and efficiency means that I felt safe re Covid and would always recommend Bridgnorth X Ray Department.

author: LaurenA88
title: Wonderful experience at Wishaw General Trauma
body:
In for an op on my arm and the staff could not have been better. Amazing communication and friendly staff.  
I had such a positive experience in so grateful to all who looked after me, especially Gwen for the post op care.

title: Professional
body:
Your Review:  Truly greatfull for my path to cross with the Admission nurse, she was caring, understanding, patient and professional,  truly a credit to her profession. Her ability to make you feel valued, respected and seen is second to none, she has gone above and beyond.
I am eternally grateful to her and to the Spire for their duty of care, 🙏
Thankyou

author: JWishy
title: Knee replacement
body:
I have just had a knee replacement at Cannock Chase Hospital. The care I received from all of the staff was amazing. They are so caring and compassionate and have a lot of patience. They really helped me on my road to recovery.  
The food was really good (for a hospital) with a variety of choice.  
The only downside was the foot pumps that had to be worn during the night. These were very noisy and restrictive making sleep very difficult.  
The hospital was spotless and all staff wore full PPE to prevent the spread of covid.  
I cannot thank them enough for my care.

author: Cardy51
title: Sleep apnoea
body:
I was always tired and listless and my husband complained that my snoring was getting worse. I consulted my GP who referred me to the Sleep Apnoea clinic who saw me a few weeks later. The following Saturday I was booked in for a "sleep over" and wired to a computer for the night.  
A week later my diagnosis was in. Sleep Apnoea - moderate. This meant that I stopped breathing whilst asleep an average of 20 times an hour. Within 10 days I had a CPAP machine delivered to my home. Learning to sleep with a face mask on was a learning curve but there was always support from the clinic when I needed it.  
My Sleep Apnoea journey began in 2010 and now, almost 12 years later, my condition is down in normal perimeters to around twice in an hour (and often less) that I stop breathing and I don't have that "foggy" feeling when I wake and I don't feel the need to nap frequently. I feel like a different person from how I was 12 years ago. My consultant always praises me for being 100% compliant and I never fail to take my CPAP machine away with me even when travelling abroad.

title: Car parking shambles
body: I recently visited my GP on 14/03/22 and duly paid my 50p to park upon leaving the car park. I have just arrived home to a parking fine from Parking Eye for non payment of parking charges. I have lodged an appeal immediately attaching a screen shot of the 50p leaving my bank from my online banking app and I now await the outcome of that appeal. I know my father is in a similar position having recently attended to see GP he paid his 50p in cash before leaving the car park. He has no receipt and obviously you no longer get a ticket to display. He appealed and was told as he had no proof the fine still stood. It is clear that the machine is faulty as I also paid but still got a fine issued by post. I only have proof as I paid by contactless. You need to get a grip of this company and their clearly faulty machine. My dad and I cannot be the only ones this has happened to recently. I don’t see why my dad should be penalised for this when he knows he paid. Surely if you’ve had other patients complaining of this similar issue recently you could provide some sort of written complaint to Parking Eye to assist my dad (and me if they don’t accept my screen shot as proof!) in this matter. The machine is clearly faulty.

author: weechris
title: Outstanding standard of care
body: I went into A & E at Forth Valley Royal Hospital with severe stomach pains. Although I had a long wait there , once I was seen by a doctor my treatment progressed very quickly. I was diagnosed with appendicitis after examination, blood tests and a scan. I was taken to the Surgical Assessments unit where I was looked after by consultants, doctors and nurses who were all excellent. I was later allowed to go home but with follow up consultation. Since I came home I have been called twice by consultants to make sure I was recovering well. The standard of care I have received has been outstanding. I can't thank the staff enough for their attention.

author: lotiongb65
title: Top marks
body: Excellent service, helped my recovery from a foot ulcer, friendly staff took optimum care of me. Top marks for the podiatry team Carlisle Centre.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: ospreywb74
title: Could not be more grateful
body:
I would like to thanks to Patricia ( The Bradbury centre Lisburn road ) for our outstanding care.  
I could not be more grateful for al the measures that have been put in place at the Bradbury centre, specific a big thanks to Patricia. For the wound care on my leg. Simply "She is the best!!!"  
Thanks

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: learningbm55
title: Sti treatment
body: This was my first time at a sexual health clinic and I had Kim and jess and they made me feel extremely comfortable, making jokes and being light hearted yet very serious about the matter. I could have not asked for a better experience and in any other senario I’d say I’d be returning but for this let’s hope that’s not the case haha!

author: defenderbf55
title: Lots of information
body:
I was recommended this service by my CPN following inpatient mental health treatment and a new diagnosis. Recovery college made the process of signing up very easy. They provided me and my CPN with information which meant I was able to choose the best courses for my needs.  
The one thing I did struggle with was the talk around controlling diet and exercise as one of my diagnoses is Anorexia nervosa. Obviously this is a bi-product of the courses not being tailored to specific illnesses. That being said it was good to meet others with different points of view and backgrounds as they all brought unique ideas to the table. Debbie, Marcus and Robyn were all kind and engaging and helped make things less anxiety provoking for me.

author: januaryeb84
title: Can't speak highly enough
body:
My husband who referred to East Leake leg ulcer clinic by the vascular consultant at QMC. Compression bandaging was prescribed as his leg ulcer hadn't healed after several months of treatment with dressings.  
Jollie and Sharow were the main nurses who dealt with the compression bandaging, others filling in when needed.  
We can't speak highly enough of the professionalism they showed at all times. Not only was there nursing practice excellent, but they went out of there way to make my husband feel at ease they were empathetic, kind and patient, so he felt supported and encouraged at each visit. The ulcer healed after a fairly short time, for which were glad, but I know he will miss his kind nurses.

author: peppertj44
title: Calm and inviting atmosphere
body:
Calm and inviting atmosphere at the Day Hospice (ward 1). It give an opportunity to be open and share, if you want to, with the nurses as well as the other patients. It feels very unpressurised and relaxed.  
Time out, change of scenery and look forward to coming back fortnightly.  
It is a shame that because of COVID, the last 2 years, the time is less and thus the activities and complementary therapies have had to be put off.

author: woodpeckerhz76
title: Couldn't have done a better job
body:
I find WARD B2 a great place it's my 2nd time on section I was at the priory Nottingham last year and it took me 8 weeks to get of section whereas on B2 I got of section after 11 days very pleased with all the staff they couldn't have done a better job.  
Thank You.

author: statuscw45
title: Good care agency
body: I was referred to 1HTT via 111. The GP surgery did absolutely nothing to help me. So in desperation I phoned 111. Before I was having suicidal thoughts but not now I feel better thanks to 1HTT. They've now referred to another care agency unfortunately I can only have 1HTT for so long. I will miss them all lots.

author: Nic123
title: Made me feel very reassured
body: I had an outpatient appointment in Ward 23a in Ninewells hospital yesterday to have a lumbar puncture procedure. I suffer from anxiety and panic attacks which made going into hospital very difficult for me. The consultant who did the procedure was brilliant, as was the doctor who assisted him. He explained everything to me and made me feel very reassured under his care, making the experience far less difficult for me. The student nurse who helped him was amazing too and made the whole thing much easier with her kindness and understanding. Unfortunately I didn't remember names. In addition, the healthcare assistant who popped in a few times to check I was ok and showed me the buzzer system made me feel at ease and was very kind, as was the student doctor.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: great experience in Craigavon hospital
body: My experience in Craigavon hospital has been absolutely great! The staff on the ward and in the emergency department when entering the hospital, have all made me feel very welcome. If I ever need anything the nurses are always quick to come and help. The communication with the doctors on the ward is also really good, I get regular updates on my care. If I ever have any questions are worries, there always there to reassure me and provide me with any information needed to help answer my questions.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nice food
body: All the staff at lurgan are absolutely amazing, they are all very friendly. The food is actually very nice. I have been in lurgan hospital now for a few weeks, I came over by the ambulance which took about 45 minutes. The cleanliness is also great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Lovely nurses
body: I came over to Lurgan from Craigavon by an ambulance. I am very well looked after here in Lurgan the nurses are lovely. The food isn’t the best but it is okay. I haven’t got much of an appetite anyway, I am not a big eater. The cleanliness is brilliant the cleaners work very hard to make sure the place looks spotless

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Needs have been met appropriately by staff
body: My stay in Craigavon hospital has been great, I’ve been treated with such respect by all members of staff both on the ward and throughout the hospital. I feel as if all my needs have been met appropriately by the nurses and doctors. I’ve been making use of the virtual visiting service that is available now for the patients. It’s been amazing being able to see my daughter’s faces and being able to talk to them before I go to sleep. It’s made my family and I so happy as they know that I am being looked after very well, and it gives me someone to talk to. As it can get very boring in here after a while.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cmckinley
title: I felt so comforted and looked after
body: Two lovely auxiliary nurses came and helped me after I had my twins and was very upset. They stayed with me all night and took care of me and my twins. I felt so comforted and looked after. Their names were lesleyann and Anna.  Anna was training to be a midwife. I will never forget them

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: JB287
title: Very friendly and professional
body:
I attended an outpatient appointment at Forth Valley Royal Hospital to have a small ulcer removed from my face.  
The staff who dealt with me (David, Maureen and Aimee) were very friendly and professional. Everything about the procedure was explained very clearly by David.  
Throughout the procedure David was explaining things to Aimee, a Student Nurse and the procedure was made quick and easy as everyone was generally chatting with me and each other throughout.  
After the procedure was complete the aftercare was explained well and I was given an information leaflet to take away with me.

author: Tforb
title: The best assessment and aftercare
body: We went to Altnagelvin Hopsital, Derry as my son had his first asthma attack. This was understandably a very scary experience for us all however the consultant who assessed us Dr Hall in A&E ensured my son had the best assessment and aftercare and we as parents were fully informed of his condition. We were never provided any information prior to this however the respect, time committed to us and information shared made us feel a sense of hope again in the NHS after such a difficult few years.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: cruxys49
title: The staff were magnificent
body:
I would like to thank nurses Elaine, Sharon, Carol and Amanda for their attentive skills and patient awareness, which they showed me during my 2 short visits to Crosshouse Hospital recently. They were magnificent.  
I would also like to thank Dr. Colgan (Dermatologist) for her caring manner and skills.

author: AmbersAlters
title: Our attempts to get an accurate diagnosis
body:
We have been trying to get a diagnosis of DID so we can access appropriate help since early 2021. We were offered an assessment in November which was over the phone, we questioned how efficiently DID can be diagnosed over the phone but were told it can be.They were half an hour late calling which exasperated our anxiety. We found them to be immediately invalidating and quoting out of date knowledge. At the end of the traumatic one hour and twenty minute unstructured assessment we were so dissociated we were unable to remember what had happened.  
They repeatedly said that DID was rare, while some of the latest findings suggest it affects 1-3% of the population - it’s as common as red hair.We were told that we couldn’t have a diagnosis of DID as it isn’t in the ICD-10, which is right, but on the 1st January 2022 the ICD-11 was released, in which DID is now a diagnosable disorder, and services who are keeping themselves up to date have been diagnosing DID for months/years in anticipation of this change.  
It took a month for us to find out what was in the report, as we were bounced back and forth between our GP and SPA - neither who would even advise us of the diagnosis we had been given, let alone the contents of the report.  
When we got the report we found that it entirely invalidates our experience, it diagnoses us with: “Mixed dissociative (conversion) disorder including symptoms of multiple personality disorder. Mixed personality disorder with traits of emotionally unstable, histrionic and anxious avoidant personality disorder”. We don’t understand how a diagnosis this comprehensive can be achieved over the phone in such a short space of time. There is no explanation of how or why we have mixed dissociative (conversion) disorder.  
The report states that we have projective identification - that others told us we have DID and we then manifested it. He questions that the abuse one of our alters, the host and alter who has lived most of the life, remembered in 2019 might be a false memory. We have a trauma holder who held the memory of that abuse for 36 years, she caused the decades of anxiety and depression and we are still trying to heal her. Another alter went to the police about the abuse. We are waiting to give our evidence - with a report that suggests it’s a false memory.  
The report states we cannot be self aware, when it had been explained to him the efforts it took to start to find her system, and the months of working with the first ‘found’ alter, while thinking this was her inner child. We wrote about the experience of ‘splitting’ before we had heard of DID, or had connected to anyone with a dissociative disorder.  
Since then, staff from Walkley House Medical Centre have been advocating for us with SPA in our attempts to have an accurate diagnosis and seek the appropriate trauma-focused psychotherapy we need. But we’ve been told we will not be having another assessment and should try to find help with the diagnosis we have.  
We aren’t happy as we know of another case where there was an inaccurate diagnosis.  
We worry how many others are suffering because of the lack of knowledge about dissociative disorders. We’re often suicidal and suffering from the lack of support available. We don’t understand how a diagnosis this comprehensive and damning can be considered acceptable, without at least a second opinion to clarify.  
We will be writing to yourselves, the service, maybe some MPs. It’s taken us a few months to recover from the trauma of a shambolic assessment and diagnosis, but we won’t be quiet anymore. How many people has this service given inaccurate diagnoses to?  
- J. (I’m our writer and can mostly speak objectively about things, but obviously several of us are angry) on behalf of the others.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Charlie2020
title: A two month stay after a stroke in Edgware Neurological Centre
body:
I had a stroke at the end of December 2021. After a month in the Royal Free I was sent for rehabilitation to Edgware Neurological Centre.  
The staff were wonderful, the nursing team were like a second family and showed great kindness. Over the two month stay I had physio daily and was shown specific exercises to regain movement in my arm.  
I am now able to move my hands and will continue to use the exercises I have learnt. I would like to thank all the staff for their professionalism and patience with me through this frightening time.

author: MJ200
title: Mixed experience of early pregnancy service
body:
I want to remind staff working at the EPAS that although you deal with people experiencing pain, bleeding or miscarriage every day there is someone extremely anxious, distressed or grieving on the other side of care.  
I lost my first pregnancy 2 years ago and found the EPAS to be helpful and reassuring. They scanned me, obtained bloods and brought me back for further assessment.  
A year later I found myself pregnant again with pain and bleeding. I called EPAS and was advised my pregnancy was too early (same weeks as previous miscarriage) and they would not assess me and that ‘’I should have known better’’.  
I went on to lose my pregnancy at home with no support from this service. It made grieving this loss a lot harder and has taken me nearly a year to feel better mentally after this experience.

author: cruxmg33
title: Made me feel much better
body:
Medicines Adherence Pharmacist  
1/ **What was good?**  
-Getting your tablets sorted out for you and getting told what they are for  
-The paper sheeting explaining reasons what tablets are doing for you and the best time for taking them.  
-Also if you need them changed or whatever, helps there  
2/ **How did it make you feel?**  
-You feel much better because knowing someone else is in charge of this part (tablets sorted for you) and if you need help, they are there for your sake.  
3/ **What could have been better?**  
- I feel like this worked well. The help I got from Sharon (Knockbracken pharmacist) was good. Thank you Sharon. (Be hard to beat).  
-When you have R/A you need help from all sides - Believe me.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: marchxy36
title: Alcohol dependency and poor mental health
body: Self medicated with alcohol to numb feelings from PTSD, as 18 month wait for NHS Mental Health Services and medication from GP had been reduced.

author: Pleased15
title: Gratitude for my breast cancer care
body:
I wish to thank the wonderful team at Hairmyres and Monklands hospitals who have looked after me since my breast cancer diagnosis in August 2021.  
The Oncologist team under Mr Hicks, the nurses at Monklands who administered my chemotherapy. Mr Murphy, Surgeon who performed my Mastectomy and the wonderful young anaesthetist who did everything in his power to make sure my operation went ahead in spite of my “racing” pulse. Elaine, my wonderful breast cancer nurse who was very caring and helpful.  
Words cannot express my gratitude. The NHS at its very best and all throughout the ongoing problems caused with Covid.  
Thank you all.

author: NorthEast74
title: Husband's care & review
body: My husband started to become unwell early last year and was seen by his GP who was really good and did the necessary referrals. He was seen by a consultant in RCH for memory concerns (equally as good and prompt), who referred him to a Aberdeen Neuro specialist and for an MRI, as the initial concern was a stroke. This was back in Nov 2021. He had the MRI 7 weeks ago, but my husband's condition is getting worse month by month, and there seems to be no urgency. I called Aberdeen Neuro who would only confirm him to be on the referral list and nothing else. We were told to wait 6wks for the MRI results, which we have done but the GP still can not access them. We have to wait for the neuro specialist to see him, before going back to RCH to get results. This can be long enough. All adverts say stroke is an urgent 999 call, yet here we are, coming up to 5 months later and still no scan results. I keep getting told there is staff sickness and so everything is delayed. Why can the GP not give us the results, to start any required immediate treatment. Any delay and irreversible damage, we will lose forever. This is not acceptable, it’s preventable by reading a simple result and allowing us to start treatment. We only got the MRI by requesting a cancellation, which the staff at WGH radiology were really sympathetic about and got my husband squeezed in. As a family, we just want to know what’s going on and start treatment sooner rather than later, to help my husband. We have waited patiently but this is getting us nowhere with no answers.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: lotionsn68
title: Embarrassed at attending sexual health clinic
body:
My coil was causing pain and discomfort with discharge. I was initially given a phone consultation with my GP and prescribed antibiotics.  
After 3 days I contacted the GP again and was given an appointment for the next day. I visited my GP who informed me that the surgery didn’t get involved with coils, but advised me that I had clinical signs of infection and should have it removed as soon as possible. I was given two numbers to contact.  
Upon contacting the numbers I was informed that it was the Sexual health clinic and this was the only way I could get my coil removed. I have been married and in a stable relationship for 10 years, and I’ve never been to a sexual health clinic. My husband had to drive me.  
I was really embarrassed about having to go there as I’m not familiar with the area and feel ashamed about having to attend this clinic, especially as I am a nurse.  
The service was good but some of the staff kept staring at me when I was sat in the waiting area which made me feel really uncomfortable. I could also hear what staff were talking about in the reception room which I felt was unprofessional.

author: Very Thankful 29
title: An accident from a fall into a confined space
body:
I fell backward onto concrete steps into a confined space into a bunker whilst taking a picture. My injuries were broken shoulder, broken ribs and broken coccyx.  
My care started with the ambulance crews who attended plus the specialist ambulance crew who had to get me out and down a steep hill. Then moving on to A&E.  
Once I was stable I was put into HD. After a short stay in HD I was moved onto the Major Trauma Ward.

author: Nicd
title: Amazing care and attention for my mum
body:
My Mum was admitted to Victoria hospital last week after suffering severe stomach pains.  
After being referred for a CT Scan we were informed she would need emergency major surgery to remove a tumour that had caused a hole in her bowel. I am an only child and my Mum is my world so needless to say I was terrified by the entire thing.  
Mr Robertson the surgeon was amazing from the start keeping my mum and myself informed every step of the way. He is one amazing man who clearly is very good at his job. My mum spent time in surgical high dependency where she was very well cared for by Lauren and Julie and the excellent consultant Ben and Doctor (Philip?) so when we were told she would be moving to ward 44 we were a little apprehensive.  
We had no reason to worry the staff were amazing Chloe Ashley Elaine Joseph the Auxiliaries Jacqueline and Susan and in particular Dawn Dora and Elka who were with my Mum the most and gave her the most amazing care and attention. I cant thank you all enough. It is very clear how much you all love your work.  
The pain team Steph, Cheryl and Ashley, Wendy the lead colorectal nurse specialist, Carol the physio and the domestics who again were very friendly and happy in their work. Thank you all.

title: accessing the service
body: Not everyone feels comfortable calling the telephone line and speaking about  their sexual problems while they are at work. The hours available to call overlap with working times - what are people supposed to do? The online booking service - has not worked for weeks. You don't score very high on accessibility. Also, you might want to train your telephone/booking staff to show a little empathy.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ay0ub24
title: The staff made me feel welcome and calm and comfortable
body:
I was admitted yesterday at around 3am regarding an incident which I can't share for personal reasons, however the staff are aware of what happened.  
When I was first admitted I would be lying to say I wasn't scared, however the nurses who looked after me were wonderful. They made me feel welcome despite the circumstances and made me feel calm throughout the entire visit. I was started treatment almost instantly and throughout the night/ day was amazing giving the circumstances of what's happening in that hospital.  
The first nurse I met along with a student nurse were lovely. I'm sorry but I am terrible with names. They did all the checks and bloods that needed to be done but if I'm honest with you, while it is A&E it really felt quite personal to me at my darkest time. They were calm, soft spoken and really really sweet. That made me feel really calm during that visit. They made sure I was comfortable at all times and if I needed assistance they were there almost instantly. Also good luck to the trainee nurse as well as she was amazing as well. Extremely caring and lovely.  
Throughout the entire day when the shifts were swapped the other nurses were lovely as well, ensuring that I was okay and assisted me in a few things and if I was thirsty or hungry they always got me something.  
The communication with the nurses was great in which it flowed through nicely. I am extremely thankful for the nurses at A&E who helped me a lot. And given the circumstances that we are in sometimes praise is lost when needed.  
The doctors were really nice as well and kept me informed of what was happening with my care. I understand the stress we are in during this time but I do wish to say that yous did your best that night and if an emergency ever arises again in life I would be happy to have my care in your hands again.  
Thank you so much, it really meant the world to me yesterday and I hope yous all keep well.

author: Jamie84
title: Autism/ADHD assessment
body: I submitted my questionnaire, then I called two weeks later to receive an update and was advised by the receptionist that staff were mainly working from home due to covid, that they would contact the relevant person and someone would call me back. After i never received a callback, I phoned again two days later and the receptionist was very rude to me. They acted as if I'd personally insulted them, complained that covid was causing problems and that the person I needed to speak to was having a PCR test today, as if this was something I should already have been aware of. When I challenged them that I was told I would receive a callback the following week and wasn't told a timescale, again they were was very rude towards me, then put me on some indefinite call holding thing where for 5 minutes a voice repeatedly told me ever second that they were trying to connect my call, only for my call to eventually be disconnected. I did not deserve the way I was spoken to, and its made me feel terrible. I apologise that I got angry on the phone but I wouldn't have had I not been treated this way. All I want to know is what is happening and if possible, how long I need to wait for a callback. I was never told a timescale but treated as if my 2 calls in 3 days were some sort of harassment.

author: Margaret. 124
title: I had a bad fall
body: I had a bad fall in the bathroom which resulted in me getting two hairline fractures in my back, and also three hematomas on my right leg. Was in hospital for three weeks. They were very caring.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Suzie45
title: Knee replacement
body: Fantastic staff and doctors. Really helpful. Reassured me when I was feeling unwell and were quick to get me feeling better again.

author: Coleraine
title: My care in the hospital
body: From when i went through my operation until i was discharged my care from everyone in BCH was super. A big thanks to everyone who cared for me on 5 south ward,so friendly,helpful and understanding.This made my stay more comfortable.10 out of 10 for all care.Keep up your great work 5 south ward. Many Thanks and Kind Regards.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: livray0101
title: Staff were lovely
body: had an implant fitted at with Sam and another nurse, so sorry I forgot your name! both were lovely and worked very well together. they made me feel at such ease! thank you ladies :)

author: phoenixjb64
title: Subcutaneous implant
body:
I went today to have my subcutaneous implant fitted. All the staff was very efficient, cordial and competent. 
I probably would provide the clinic with urine sample pots instead of plastic glass for urine sample. 
The service was punctual, quick and the staff made me feel very comfortable.

title: Please answer the phone!
body: The difficulty is that phones are not answered , messages are left and no one replies. Switchboard answers and diverts your call, no one picks up! This is a very poor reflection on the overall services of the hospital.

title: ridiculous waiting time, poor hygiene standards
body:
Our waiting time to see doctor and have blood test done was about 9 hours after being reffed by GP.

Nurses were very friendly and helpful.

My daughter was seen by two doctors, one of them friendly with professional attitude, another one arrogant and unprofessional, not following basic standards of infection control policies neither wearing her badge or introducing herself.

I was unpleasantly surprised non of the doctors were interested to find out what is it what causes the pain and discomfort. The only aim was to get rid of the pain but I wanted to know where was the problem.

No hand wash or hand sanitiser in paediatric department, toilet there hasn’t been cleaned for longer than 11 hours (from the sheet on it’s door).

author: sambafr35
title: Appointment at family planning
body: Dr Nams went through all my recent gynae history including calling my GP for information they had not provided me with previously. She took time to listen and then talk me through all my options, giving her professional recommendation with full reasoning, but ultimately letting me decide what was best for me. She then provided me with my chosen pills on the spot, along with clear instructions, and made sure she would personally do my follow-up appointment after the initial trial. I left feeling more informed, reassured and confident than I ever have done after a medical appointment.

title: No clarity
body: My daughter has been in there for 3 days. I have called numerous times a day since the day she went in. Not once have they answered the phone. I was told by home treatment team that I'd be able to visit her. Lies! I'm getting very distressed calls from my child and I cannot even speak to anyone about it. I have been given no information or consideration. Not to mention the fact that you're treated like a pain when you drop stuff off or call switchboard.

author: Nannie
title: My stay in hospital
body: Was admitted to A&E for abdominal pain was a long wait but was the same for everyone after going through different parts of A&E before being moved onto Maple ward my experience was very reassuring our NHS teams in Scarborough are amazing my stay was positive can't say enjoyable because no-one wants to be in hospital but I would like to thank every single one of you wonderful ppl for my outstanding care many of the staff go above and beyond and the food was delicious lots of choice for all tastes and diets thank you all so much

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Difficult to Get an Appointment Time
body:
The doctors and secretaries are excellent and other staff in general are polite and helpful. 
However,  appointments still seem to be on a triage basis for the same day on the telephone, with no specific appointment time. Even when I pre-booked days in advance to speak with a named doctor, this still resulted in me being offered a date but no time when I requested one.  This makes being available to take calls, yet alone in private, very difficult and I do not think it is acceptable.

author: lacertaqg67
title: A positive experience
body:
I have attended the Maxillofacial and ENT out patient department at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary on two occasions in the past 2 months. The staff were absolutely terrific. They all put me at ease given that it was an urgent referral and provided a very person centred individualised service.  
I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone in the department , with special mention to Consultant Mr Mcdonald, Mr Mitchell who undertook my scans and the lovely nurses Rachel and Alison. Keep doing what your doing - you should all be very proud of yourselves. Thank you

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: South Eastern HSC Trust
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff could not have been more friendly
body: I had a very positive experience at Ward 4C. Hospital admission is something I had previously been keen to avoid but the staff could not have been more friendly and caring towards myself. I'm very grateful and felt very safe.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Hopeless
body: Engage Consult never works. NHS APP does not work. Cannot order medication via telephone. These are not new problems. No-one ever does anything and boy have I tried! Funny how the surgery responds to favourable reviews on here but not negative ones.....

author: ssmall
title: My mammy fell off a bike
body: On Sunday my mum who is in her 80's fell off an exercise bike injuring herself quite badly. She was attended initially by Paul, a Rapid Response Paramedic who very efficiently treated her pain and reassured her. NIAS brought her to Antrim Hospital @NHSCT. Her initial assessment and treatment in ED was both prompt and attentive. When stabilised mammy was transferred to the Ambulatory Emergency Care Unit, AEC for further assessment and pain treatment. It was decided that an overnight stay at the very least was required and she was transferred to C1. Her level of care here has been amazing, no stone has been left unturned in the assessment and treatment of acute on chronic pain. Speaking to her by phone today she stated “ that she doesn’t know how she can thank all staff for the way they are looking after her and preparing her for discharge”. My thanks to everyone for looking after and caring such a precious little lady, my mammy . ⭐️

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Much improved service and great patient care
body:
I have been a patient with Albany for over a decade. I have always had reasonable experience with them. But I must say they have improved so much now! The patient access is so much better. Our calls get answered very quickly. Reception team is much aware now what they are doing. Reception team is the front face of the company and seems like they have invested in that. I am so glad that they have well trained reception team. 
I have got the opportunity to speak to the new Practice Manager as well who is very lovely, professional and super efficient. I have had couple of issues lately, their manager called to help me and resolved all the matters.  
I have never ever experienced this good service from Albany in the last 10 years. They have gone beyond and above.
Not to forget clinical staff and few of the old admin staff have always been super helpful.
Keep the momentum going Albany team !

title: Absolutely Marvellous.
body:
I went to Optegra, in February 2022.
And I had surgery on my right eye, it was to remove the Cataracs, The surgeon talked me through all the info, he did a great job, it was all over and done within half an hour,
All the staff made you feel at ease, 
Any questions and they would answer too let you know, what’s the procedures were, they really did look after you,
It’s really fantastic I can see a lot clearer now, I can’t wait to have the left eye done,
I would like to Thank all the staff, and the surgeon, for looking after me and my surgery at ( Optegra ) In Bradford,
I would recommend ( Optegra ) for the NHS. Thanks again for a great job.
Regards Peter. In Leeds. 25/3/2022.

author: NelleBelle
title: Made me feel comfortable and relaxed
body:
Hello I called at Pilgrim hospital today in outpatients for bloods and obs as I am due a procedure next week.  
I can’t praise the member of staff enough today I think she was health care assistant not too sure she was an actual Diamond made me feel comfortable and relaxed and was just a genuine lovely lady. Thank you .

author: mBrown
title: Grateful for their level of care
body: I have attended the Urogynaecology Unit on a regular basis for many years, and the service that I have always received from the Nursing staff is in my opinion, outstanding. I have always been treated with absolute respect, and they have always done their very best to provide a level of care that enables me to have a good quality of life and avoiding fairly complex surgery. I was seen regulary by Janice and now Claire and am always very grateful for their level of care and competence.

author: Suzie21
title: Impressive service at Ulster Hospital A&E
body:
Arrived at A&E on Sunday morning around 8.30am and leaving at 10.30am. Nurse, doctor, X-rays and Physio all seen in this time.  
Very impressive service from the staff in the hospital. Follow up MRI appointment scheduled for a week later. Service couldn't be better following very unsatisfactory patient/family care in another trust over the course of a year.  
Well done South Eastern Trust.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: AndyP1957
title: Having severe anxiety and attending for endoscopy
body:
I had to attend this department due to having a degree of rectal bleeding. I suffer badly from anxiety to such extent I am registered disabled.  
Prior to the visit my wife asked if we could wait in a separate room rather than communal, and this request was accommodated and it was also agreed that I would have a mild sedative to help me during the procedure.  
On the day my anxiety issues were very bad, but without exception all the staff were very friendly and supportive and my wife was allowed to stay with me - she could have attended the procedure but declined.  
The procedure was explained clearly in advance and went even smoother than I was expecting which made me less anxious. I did not feel embarrassed or anything negative whatsoever about anything.  
Being given results on the day was also a massive relief for myself although if a biopsy was needed there would have been a delay of a week or so.  
The only thing I would suggest could be improved upon, is if a person suffers with severe anxiety issues perhaps they could be scheduled near the top of the procedure list, rather than random. This suggestion was conveyed to the nurse who summarised matters to us, and she thought it a very good idea which she was going to pass on.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: pelicanwb94
title: I felt very well supported
body: I was diagnosed quickly with lymphatic cancer and due to how unwell I was at that time, I was admitted to hospital very quickly for treatment to start.  I felt very well supported and cared for by the nursing staff, both when I was an inpatient and when I received my chemotherapy treatment as an outpatient.  I felt able to ask my nurses anything and they would explain things to me in a clear and sensitive way.  I felt I could trust the nurses to look after me well and they were very knowledgable and good at their jobs.  I always felt welcomed onto the day patient ward each time I visited and that the nurses took a genuine interest in how I was and how I was coping with the treatment.  I have only praise for the doctors and nurses who looked after me and I feel grateful to have gone through my cancer treatment so smoothly and well supported by the medical team around me.

author: Davjp39
title: Staff at Willow Ward eye unit really care
body:
I had to go into the Willow Ward eye unit for an eye procedure under local anaesthetic, not a major issue I admit but still worrying and concerning for me.  
From the moment I arrived to discharge I was treated in a friendly, professional manner, made to feel at ease and the procedure was explained to me in clear non-medical language by staff including the consultant surgeon.  
I felt like a person not a number and the staff really cared about what they did. Thank you so so much.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sonny crockett
title: The Main Kitchen
body:
I have been currently in hospital for nearly 5 weeks...the staff on the ward have been excellent...however the food is a massive problem...not even so much the food...as the kitchen who appear not to care.  
For instance.. when your order is placed the day before, they basically on certain days send you whatever they want to or the same dinner for everyone...totally unacceptable.  
Do the kitchen not care?  
Also, would you please stop using BEBO spread on the toast and bread, on the rare occasion you get Dromona. I feel BEBO is beyond consumption and should not be used in any environment. Use a Irish or British made product rather than this cheaply manufactured product import in from Eastern Europe or something at low cost.  
People like myself on special renal diet, would also like a variety...not the same repetitive every day....and not even a dessert often offered.  
When someone is in hospital convalescing , the kitchen appear to be doing the opposite to help them.....  
I wish for someone to take this on-board and look forward to a positive outcome.  
Thankyou very much

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Top Angler
title: Outstanding care for kidney failure
body:
A day in October 2020 is a date that I will never forget. It was morning and I as usual was at work feeling a little unwell, so I went home.  
The next thing was being taken to GWH Swindon in an ambulance and after various tests, was taken to Churchill Hospital Oxford whereupon my treatment was commenced immediately being taken to theatre to have tubes inserted into my groin to cleanse my blood which had become toxic having not passed water for 6 days. The protein and creatinine levels in my blood were off the scale. Didn't rate my chances much!  
Next came a day in dialysis followed by procedures to insert tubes into my urinary pipe between kidneys and bladder to help me pee. The reason for the tube was because of a blockage in urinary pipe. This being the cause of my pain for which I had taken too many Ibuprofen tablets which caused the kidneys to fail.  
After 10 days of treatment and care which was outstanding, I walked out of the hospital fully fit and very, very grateful. My stents are changed every 6 months under general anaesthetic.  
I am back at work and living a full life at 70 years old. I fully intend to find those wonderful staff in urology and hug them all and just say thank you.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Is0bel
title: Quick CT Scan led to quick diagnosis
body:
Following an acute pain episode I was assessed and treated at the EmSU.  
The service was slick, quick and highly professional. I was assessed by the Advanced nurse practitioner Helen. Her experience knowledge and bedside manner made me feel at ease. I was also assessed by Mr Alanie and Mr Byrnes who again made me feel at ease and despite the very busy unit provided a very patient centred thorough consultation. The nursing staff in the unit ensure that full thorough and timely investigation happens.  
I attended for Ct scan within 2 hours of arriving in the unit. My Ct was reported within the hour. This was amazing. This led to swift diagnosis.  
I would like to also thank the radiographers who explained the procedure and had me turned around in minimal time. In summary although this was an extremely busy unit I was provided with patient centred care which made me feel I was treated as an individual by total professionals. This also meant that I avoided having to attend ED and add to the pressure in that system.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jillsy
title: Cancellation of procedure
body:
My daughter has been having recurring urine infections for two years. She received a letter advising of surgery being carried out today at Monklands hospital.  
Having been for a Covid test and asked to self isolate until procedure she booked a week off work (she’s self employed). The hospital phoned and asked if she could come in earlier than scheduled this morning. When arrived she was booked in, gowned up to be told that as she was to get a general anaesthetic the operation would be cancelled today unless she agreed to an alternative procedure with a local anaesthetic which she refused.  
The details of her procedure have been spoken about many times before today and the medical team were well aware that the procedure needed a general anaesthetic.  
My daughter is totally distraught being sent home to wait for new appointment time. She has lost a weeks pay for absolutely nothing. Why was she phoned to come early for procedure for it to be cancelled.  
I know the NHS under major pressure but so are we all and after two years of illness this seems totally unacceptable. The impact this recurring illness has on her mental health is concerning and as a mum I’m really worried about how this will affect her.

author: julycm69
title: Feeling abandoned in A&E
body: My mother who's 72 came into A&E, brought in by us as no ambulance available. She had paralysis on left leg and loss of bladder control and balance, and was left sitting in a chair in A&E for 23 hours. She did have blood test and a ct scan while she was waiting but was told no beds available, me and my dad had to hoist her to the toilet as nobody else offered to help and after spending the night sat in one position which can't be good for blood clots she was almost delirous. So although I understand hospitals are overwhelmed and understaffed I find this treatment of patients unacceptable , where is the duty of care ? It was one of the most traumatic things I have been through seeing my mum so vulnerable and there was nothing I could do to help.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Nerzr58
title: Day surgery
body:
Ealing hospital, Brunel 3North.  
Fantastic members of staff, right through from the nurses, anaesthetists and Drs. Everyone was so lovely, kind and caring, explaining every detail. Nurses had smiles all day (despite their extremely long shifts) registrar didn’t rush, spent time talking through what was going to be done, what may be done etc, anaesthetists put me at ease, very chatty, explained absolutely everything. All staff introduced themselves.  
Arrived early in the morning, discharged at 18.00. From start to finish, could not fault a thing. Thankyou to each and everyone of them. Amazing.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Swanny the Geordie
title: Endoscopy procedure
body: I had to go to the endoscopy suite, I was actually dreading the procedure. On arrival I was greeted by a very nice nurse called Julie who took all my details and clerked me in. She explained what would be happening and that she would be with me all the way throughout the procedure in the theatre. The girls in the theatre were also nice. It had a very relax atmosphere with a bit of banter and humour. Julie did stay talking to me and putting me at my ease. What a GREAT team. Well done everyone, xx

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: roslittle
title: Lovely nurses
body: Lovely nurses, Joan and Claire. Great attention and reassuring. Thanks.

author: matargq57
title: This made me feel so much better
body:
My 94yr old dad has been in hospital for 3weeks now and due to no visits he is missing the family. He is now in a side room at RVH and forgets to charge or turn his mobile on. 
As we havent seen him and worrying that he thinks we have abandoned him i remembered being told my staff that i could het a zoom call. As we had phone calls to this point i didnt bother but things were different now so i rang Patient Liaison to arrange this. 
It was handled, explained well and the same day i had a zoom call set up for that morning.
The link  was sent by email to which you respond. 
The staff member on the connection was so helpful even when i had a few difficulties.   The Social Work person was friendly,helpful with helping dad to hear, understand (only partial hearing) and help the conversation along. As dad was tired it was only a few minutes but enough for us both to smile,talk and blow a kiss. 
This really made me feel so much better knowing i could reassure dad and see the relief of seeing me.
I highly recommend the service and thank you to all the staff .

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: avocetkh44
title: Genital warts
body: My genital warts have been treated and staff were amazing.
